function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Chronic under-funding of the World Health Organization (WHO) leading to limited resources for global health governance.","Impact":"Diminished capacity to respond to global health crises and mitigate contagious disease propagation.","Mitigation":"Increase funding and resources for WHO, establish reliable long-term funding sources, and advocate for stronger mandates for the WHO and other UN agencies.","Technologies":"Financial tracking and management systems, international funding mechanisms, policy advocacy tools.","People":"Global population, particularly in low- and middle-income countries.","Owner":"UN agencies, national governments, international donor organizations."},{"Description":"Weakening of multilateral institutions, including the WHO, by influential developed countries.","Impact":"Reduction in WHO's ability to recruit long-term health inspectors and scientists, and a shift towards favoring individual behavior over social medicine in response to pandemics.","Mitigation":"Advocate for strengthening mandates of the UN and its agencies, promote multilateral cooperation, and address neoliberal policies that favor biomedicine over social medicine.","Technologies":"Advocacy platforms, diplomatic initiatives, policy analysis tools.","People":"Global population, particularly in low- and middle-income countries.","Owner":"UN agencies, national governments, international donor organizations."}]}
